section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The paragraph does not provide a clear process for acceptance of change orders by the Company. It states that changes must be submitted and accepted, but it does not specify the criteria or time frame for the Company's acceptance. This ambiguity can lead to disputes about whether a change order has been properly accepted and whether the Company is obligated to perform the additional work.

section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The term 'Additional Work' is broadly defined, including revisions to 'other features' without specifying what those features are. This lack of clarity could lead to disagreements about what constitutes 'Additional Work' and whether certain tasks fall within the original Scope of Work or require a Change Order, since the scope of additional work is not defined clearly.

section: All written content submitted by Client for use in the Client Website must be typewritten, proofread and delivered to Company in the body of an email message or as a Microsoft Word electronic document or plaint text electronic document. Any content submitted by Client in any other manner or format, including, but not limited to Adobe PDF format, will be returned to Client for resubmission. Company will not make any attempt to proof read or correct any contextual, grammatical or typographical errors in the written content submitted by Client. It is Client's sole responsibility to check the accuracy of the written content and correct any errors prior to submission for final publication. Company will assume that all the written content submitted by Client has been proofread and is ready for publication. Client may elect to pay Company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
explanation: The paragraph states that the Company will not proofread or correct any errors in the written content submitted by the client, but also states that the 'Client may elect to pay Company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.' There is an inconsistency in the written content here, because it is not clear whether the company can type or proofread in other circumstances. It is implied that the company will not proofread content unless in the context of fixing the format.

section: All written content submitted by Client for use in the Client Website must be typewritten, proofread and delivered to Company in the body of an email message or as a Microsoft Word electronic document or plaint text electronic document. Any content submitted by Client in any other manner or format, including, but not limited to Adobe PDF format, will be returned to Client for resubmission. Company will not make any attempt to proof read or correct any contextual, grammatical or typographical errors in the written content submitted by Client. It is Client's sole responsibility to check the accuracy of the written content and correct any errors prior to submission for final publication. Company will assume that all the written content submitted by Client has been proofread and is ready for publication. Client may elect to pay Company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
explanation: The paragraph contains a structural flaw because it bounces back and forth between the rules about client-submitted content and a caveat about paying the company for typing and proofreading. A structural flaw occurs because the rules for submission should be discussed first, followed by the possibility of the company typing/proofreading the content. The paragraph should be re-arranged.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: The term 'hourly rate' is used in the paragraph, but it is not defined anywhere in the document. It is also not clear whether the 'hourly rate' refers to the rate of one employee or if it's another figure. This ambiguity can cause confusion when calculating the surcharge for rush work.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: The paragraph mentions that a surcharge applies if rush work is required because of the client, but the paragraph does not clearly state how quickly the Company must notify the client about the additional surcharge. If the company takes too long to notify the client, the client can refuse to pay for the additional surcharge.
